newsitem.title: GUATEMALA: Guatemala August consumer prices rise 0.98 pct.
newsitem.headline: Guatemala August consumer prices rise 0.98 pct.

text.p: Guatemalan consumer prices rose 0.98 percent in August, compared to a rise of 0.60 percent in the same month last year, the National Statistics Institute said on Wednesday.
Accumulated inflation was 7.9 percent at the end of August, compared with 4.61 percent a year ago, it said.
Year-over-year inflation was 12.03 percent to August 31, up from 11.60 percent as of July 31. Year-over-year inflation at the end of August 1995 was 8.28 percent.
